discussion.content: B. It must be issued in interface configuration mode to enable the OSPF process for IPv6.

choices.D: It must be issued after the network command to enable the OSPF process for IPv6. B
choices.A: It must be issued in router global configuration mode to enable the OSPF process for IPv6.
choices.B: It must be issued in interface configuration mode to enable the OSPF process for IPv6.
choices.C: It must be issued before the network command to enable the OSPF process for IPv6.

questions.question_text: Which statement is true about the command ipv6 ospf 1 area 0?

choices.B: RT1 has a subnet mask of 64 bits.
choices.C: RT1 has FastEthernet0/0 set as a DR for network type broadcast.
choices.A: OSPFv3 uses global IPv6 addresses to establish neighbor adjacencies.
choices.D: OSPFv3 uses Link-local addresses to establish neighbor adjacencies.
choices.E: RT1 does not have a global IPv6 address set on FastEthernet0/0.
choices.F: OSPFv3 uses IPv4 addresses to establish neighbor adjacencies D

discussion.content: D. OSPFv3 uses Link-local addresses to establish neighbor adjacencies.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit. Based on the output from the show command on RT1 which statement is true?
//IMG//
questions.answer_description: OSPFv3 is an updated version of OSPF designed to accommodate IPv6 natively. OSPFv3 uses the multicast address FF02::5 and FF02::6, but like EIGRP it uses its link-local address as the source address in advertisements.

questions.question_text: Your Company trainee asks you, in the context of IPv6 and OSPF, what best describes a type 9 LSA?

discussion.content: D. Use the traceroute command to an address that is not explicitly in the routing table.

questions.answer_description:
The simplest method to test load balancing is to use the "traceroute" command. If load balancing is working correctly, we will see different paths to reach the destination each time we use that command.
Unknown address will be routed via the default-network 0.0.0.0 so we must use an address that is not explicitly in the routing table.

choices.D: Use the traceroute command to an address that is not explicitly in the routing table. D
choices.C: Use an extended ping along with repeated show ip route commands to confirm the gateway of last resort address toggles back and forth.
choices.B: Load balancing does not occur over default networks; the second route will only be used for failover.
choices.A: Use ping and the show ip route command to confirm the timers for each default network resets to 0

discussion.content:
B is correct answer. 
We are talking about authentication, not privacy.

comments.content: Maybe i did a mistake. A is a correct answer, because in SNMPv3 with authentication, privacy is an implicit condition

discussion.content: According the explanation, B is more appropriate.

questions.answer_description:
The SNMPv3 Agent supports the following set of security levels:
+ NoAuthnoPriv: Communication without authentication and privacy.
+ AuthNoPriv: Communication with authentication and without privacy. The protocols used for Authentication are MD5 and SHA (Secure Hash Algorithm).
+ AuthPriv: Communication with authentication and privacy. The protocols used for Authentication are MD5 and SHA ; and for Privacy, DES (Data Encryption
Standard) and AES (Advanced Encryption Standard) protocols can be used. For Privacy Support, you have to install some third-party privacy packages
questions.question_text: What would you configure on SNMPv3 to allow authentication?
